text: Aroma is citrus hops and earthy/sweetish malts. The flavor is fruit/citrus, biscuit/earthy malts and a mix of bitter, dry and slight tropical fruit in the finish.

Haha, what a label ! Pours rather clear blonde, OK white head. Smell is creamy, some sorachi, but not overly hoppy. Taste is very clear sorachi ace. a pumped up bitterness ( not a bitter beer, but the other sorachi beers ive had were nearly only aroma, this one has SOME bitterness ) bit crispy, mild maltyness. Nice !

500ml bottle. Slightly hazy amber color. Medium size, off-white head, stays. Fruity, citrus, malty, sweetish in aroma. Fruity, citrus, malty and sweet in taste. Grapefruit in aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Medium bitterness. Drinkable brew.
Bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts yeast spicy white fruits tropical fruits and hops flavor malts yeast spicy white fruits tropical fruits earthly notes and bitter hops

50cl bottle @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. 01-03-2016.
BBD: 07/201x. Batch: 1101.
In short: bitter smooth ale.
Pours hazy deep gold with frothy white head. Fruity, ripe fruit, spicy, citrusy nose. Medium body, average carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is moderate bitter, citrusy, some spicy.

50cl Bottle from Sterk. Hazy golden orange colour, off-white head. Aroma of grapefruit, sorachi ace hops, light creamy, floral. Flavour is light to medium sweet, malty, creamy, Sorachi Ace, sweet grapefruit, floral, firm bitter finish. Light bodied, soft mouthfeel. Good.

Bottle at Taps Beer Bar, Changkat, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a hazy medium amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is yeast, sweet malt, orange citrus, floral. The flavour is moderate bitter sweet with a crisp zesty orange fruit, sweet floral hop bitter palate and a lingering bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation.
-on tap- Fruity tropical juice meets coconut and floral. Smooth finish. Easy to like!

Marry me in Rio? Of course. Pieknie pachnace piwo kwiatami, lawenda, rumiankiem, facelia i nieco passiflora. Jasno miedziano pomaranczowe piwo, metne ze stabilna srednia piana. Smak wytawny, gozki lekko slodowy. Tresciwy i wyrazisty. Passiflora i figi, bardzo fajne wrazenia, nieco grejfruta i liczi takze bylo za sprawa amerykanskich chmieli. Udane piwo kremowe. More, more, more
Kupferfarben, weißer Schaum, fruchtcocktail melone Birne grapefruit, unterlegt von angenehmer Bittere.
Hazy amber color with stable white head. Aroma of citrus, hops. Taste is quite strong bitter with long bitter finish. Creamy mouthfeel. Well balanced beer, nice hoppy flavour. Very good.
Pours cloudy golden. Aroma is balanced, but hoppy. Mouthfeel is creamy, taste is lightly hopped first, finish has a nice hop bitterness. A nice beer, to my taste.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso riconosce subito grandi quantità di luppolo e resina versione pino, seguite da agrumi, fiori, the verde e ananas. Lintensità olfattiva invoglia subito a bevuta compulsiva, è elevata ed elegante. La persistenza olfattiva è apprezzabile. Il cappello di schiuma a bollicine medie e carbonazione media ha una buona tenuta ed è voluminosa. Lapparenza del liquido è velata. Le bollicine sono fini. La carbonazione è media, persistente ed insistita. Il colore è giallo ambrato. Il corpo è strutturato ma duttile e presenta nuove sfaccettature. Lamaro è carico. Lintensità gustativa è molto elevata e la persistenza gustativa è lunga. Il gusto è godereccio. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono luppolate. Il finale è amarognolo, lungo e complesso. Il retrogusto è intenso. In bocca laroma riporta sentori di cereali, resina, agrumi, fiori, the verde, erba e frutta secca.

Big offwhite head. Clear coppery body. Citric spicy aroma with resiny floral notes. Very fresh. Dryish fruity mealy taste with ashy floral notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft mouthfeel. Dryish resiny tropical fruit aftertaste with spicy floral notes. Mostly fresh and clean, but the ash detracts a little. (0.5l bottle, from Fish & Beer, Copenhagen. Batch #1101.)
On tap. Hazy orange white head. Grapefruit aroma, fruity hoppy bitterness, dry finish

50cl Bottle. Appearance: Hazy yellow color with an average sized white head. Aroma: peaches, oranges, pine.some malts.
Taste: Refreshing moderate sweet, moderate bitter moderate fruity citrus and peaches, hint of pine, grass, light malts and a hhint of sourness in the start. verry balanced, but maybe a bit too much smoothed out in the taste department.
 Medium body and carbonation., oily texture

50 cl bottle, batch no. 1101. Hazy, golden colour with an amber tint. Creamy off-white head. Fruity aroma with citrus fruits, pale malts, herbal fruity notes and spicy hint from Sorachi Ace hops. Taste is bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and an average carbonation. Finishes bone dry and bitter with citrus fruits and herbal fruity hints. Usual rock solid Amager quality. Well recommended.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2016 Botella 50 cl de el Lupulo tomada en el momento en veguin 13..05..2016. (r109). Lote 1101 hasta 07..2016. Color rubio amarillento algo tostado con espuma blanca. Aromas y sabores algo afrutados y herbaceos secos con amargo final seco también algo resinos y duradero. Cuerpo medio, fácil de beber con 5.5.vol. Refrescante. Bastante buena. Para repetir.
KRS 130216. Golde-orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is peaches, oranges, pine. Flavour is peaches, oranges, pine, grass, malt, bread. Bitter finish. Nice beer.
Hazy orange with a medium white head. Aroma is hops, citrus and grass. Taste is hops, malt and herbs
Bottle. Hoppy aroma of citrus, peach, pine . The flavour is moderat bitter. The body is light and the texture is juicy. Soft carbonation.
Bottle. It pours hazy golden with a white fluffy head. The aroma is malty and tropical fruity hoppy. Citrus notes. Topical fruity hoppy flavor. Light mint. Great fruity overall.

Pale yellow colour. Medium white head. Hints of berries, to be more exact, maybe currants. Sourness, hints of berries at first. Hints of caramel. Notes of wine. Bitterness in the end. Bitter, hoppy finish. Quite well balanced, interesting beer. The berries from the aroma are not coming really out from the taste. Nice brew thow.

Bottle, 0.50l. Pours cloudy amber color with large froth off-white head, nice lacing and sparkling apperance. Aroma of grapefruit, passion fruit, pine, herbs, melon and papaya. Taste starts with refreshing moderate sweet and sour fruitiness, following is astringent and grainy with mild toasted malt note, mouthfeel is spicy, while finish is heavy bitter. Light to medium body, oily texture and lively carbonation in palate. Excellent taste for such a mid ale...

from la Mise en Bière - hazy orange beer with a little foam left; hoppy aroma of flowers, grapes and light corny; medium-bodied, fizzy, light astringent and very bitter; some tart corny notes and more honey and raisins in the finish, light lingering notes of corn and vegetable - a cream ale ?!

500 ml bottle. Almost clear, golden body with a medium sized off-white head. Aroma is malty and fruity with quite distinct Sorachi Ace hops. Flavor is sweet malt, citric fruit, bread and moderate bitterness. Medium body and OK aftertaste. Decent, but not to memorable.
Clear, dark golden. White froth. Mild hop aroma, light citrus. And coconut? Citrus hoppy flavour, light malt. Dry and lasting bitterness.

Bottle, 5.5%. The aroma has a sort of vanilla that seems to come from the hops used, also soft fruit and perhaps dust. Cloudy dark golden colour. Good stable white head. The flavour starts off rather perfumy, has a distinct coconut and/or vanilla note. It goes away rather quickly, and then comes a distinct bitterness. Thin mouthfeel considering the style.

Bottle. Pours hazy lightish amber with airy off-white head. Clear aroma of hops and citrus, with notes of yeast and malt. Bitter flavour of hops and citrus, complemented by sweetish notes of malt and yeast, and round, fruity notes. Rough afteraste wi estery and slightly spicy hints. Decent.

Bottle shared at the 2015 edition of the chriso Pre-GBBF tasting - London. Cheers! Pours mostly clear yellow-gold with a creamy, white head. Juicy citrus in the aroma, some pale bread. Light to medium sweet flavour, with rindy bitterness, more pale bread, hay, pine needles. Light to medium bodied with fine carbonation. Dry on the finish, lightly resinous and rindy, with crackery pale malts. Meh, just about OK.
on tap lieve ambrato buona schiuma burrosa agrume discreto amaro finale popcorn

10.03.2016, 0,5l bottle @ home:
Huge creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly fresh floral, leafs, moss, sap, flowers, hay, sorachi hops, grass, citrus peel, rubber, unripe pineapple. Taste is dry floral, weeds, leafs, bark, flowers, sorachi hops, lawn, minerals, citrus peel, paper. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly harsh floral mouthfeel. Nice.
Bottle. Hazy yellow color. Aroma: passion fruit, mango, multifruit juice with citrus and grapefruit. Taste: multifruit, juicy Brazilian exotic fruit, citrus and pleasant hop bitterness.
This is not just a Pale Ale. There is a certain creaminess that I dont find in other beers and coupled with the generous amount of hops, this is a very pleasant experience.

Bottle. An almost clear one, golden in color and topped by a foamy, white head leaving some lacing. The aroma is soapy and lemony, with some oranges and pine cones. Malty, bready hints. Its quite piney on the palate, with oranges, generic citrus, a touch of grass and some malty hints. Its medium bodied and dry on the palate, with a nice carbonation. Bitter, grassy finish with citrus zest and a faint malty touch. Sort of boring, at least compared with their pale ales, but its a fine brew anyway. 160213

Bottle 500ml @ Geokkjer
Pours hazy deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, orange and citrus. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long orange and citrus finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. Pours golden with an off-white head. Aroma of orange, malt, some bread and herbs. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some malt, orange, some bread, bitterness and caramel.Medium body, average carbonation.
Keg at Jessop House. Pours hazy amber with a decent white head. Aroma of cream soda, pine, damp. Tastes pine and caramel, a little cream and grapefruit. Nice stuff.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; clear light copper pour with a big bubbly beige head, aroma has cream soda plus some pine hop, taste has sweet caramel, bitter grapefruit, passion fruit, tangerine, a hint of melon, some creamy action but not massive, good stuff.

Fra fat på Cardinal, Mandag i annen 01.02.16: lett uklar gylden med ok skum. Mye aroma av de forventede citrus og tropiske frukter, pluss mer eksotiske sydfrukter som lychee. Lime, ananas og blomster kommer også inn i smaksbildet. Allikevel har den en ganske tørr og behagleig ettersmak. Slank og meget lett å helle innenfor snippen.
On tap at Mi2 at Cardinal 01.02.16. Hazy dark golden. Beige head. Fine aroma and taste and aftertaste of tropical fruits, marmalade and flowers. Interesting. Merdium high bitterness.
On tap at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours hazy amber with off-white head. Aroma of pine needles, oranges, grapefruits. Tastes bitter, dry mouth feel. Bitter finish.

Bevuta alla spina al tuxedo beer house. La consistenza è cremosa, sembra panna alla frutta tropicale. Un esplosione di profumi. Sapore di agrumi, caramello Mellow e finale meravigliosamente amaro. 
Amager, non mi delude mai.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 500 ml bottle, batch #1101, will soon be available (also on tap) at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 5.5%. Hazy golden colour, moderate white head. Lovely aroma of lychee, passion fruit and citrus, also a hint of pine. Medium body. The flavour has a slight sweetness, and distinct hops throughout. Notes of tropical fruits, citrus, lemongrass and dill, pine / resin in the finish and aftertaste. Good beer. Certainly no "cream ale", but a more than decent APA.

Bottle 50cl / Botella 50cl.
@ The Beer Garden Store, Madrid, España.
A: Amber / Ambar.
T/S: Hops, citrusy, fruity / Lupulo, citrico, afrutado.

Oh yeah I am a big fan of Amager hoppy beer. When I am drinking this beer (20160114) it is listed as cream ale. It could be session IPA or something in my opinion. Lovely smooth hoopy ale as usual from this brewery. Kind of creamy texture. So well ha ha it is a nice cream ale. Lovely aroma and a fine carbonation. Mellow sweetness and a nice bitterness. Fresh and easy drinkable ale yet again Amager.[Bottle from a trade with Rasmus40]
from draft at the rover gothenburg, poured a deep golden colour with an off white head. nose has floral hops, fruity citrus, zest, cut grass, weak malts, watery. pretty boring

5.5% ABV. Cream Ale.

Poured out of the bottle a light Amber. 10ºSRM.

Nose has some nice sweet creamy aromas, right away, youre reminded of cream soda. Clean sweet nose that is light, inviting and fun.

Mouthfeel is carbonated. The palate has graham cracker, well browned wheat toast, toffee and some caramel. There is a haunting spicy note to the palate, a little like cilantro or mint, maybe Thai basil. 

The finish is medium-long with some nice hoppy character to it. Hyssop-like bitter character, which blooms and lengthens into a beautiful aroma profile of floral baby powder and chrysanthemums. I think they started with a cream ale but coudnt stay their hoppy hand in the brewing. 

Goes on Favorites List!
Flaske. Uklar,gylden . Moderat karbonert med hvit kremet skumtopp. Smaker grapefrukt, urter og litt ettersmak av dill. Som alltid har amager de beste etikettene

500ml bottle. Clear, orangey golden colour with average to huge, frothy, halfway-lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Piney and citrusy fruity aroma, notes of orange and mandarine, caramel malty basis with a sugary touch. Taste is crisp bitter hoppy, citrusy fruity, notes of orange and mandarine, slightly sweet malty basis with a dry and minimally spicy grainy touch; lingering bitter finish.

Bottled. Orange. Unclear. Light beige dense head. Aroma. Flowers, sweetness, herbs, fruits. Flavour. Citrus, flowers, some tropical fruits, herbs. Medium to full bodied. Ends flowery bitter. Easy drinkin.

Golden-orange (8-10EBC) offering a fine poring white head and fair lacings. Aromas of sugared malts/cereals, floral raspberry and hints of cocoanut with sprinkles of mango and papaya. Very fine perlage, rather smooth with a medium body. Cocoanut-fruity malt/ "frosty"-corn-flakes sweetness with a light dry fruity bitterness on the palate. Medium lasting bit cocoa-fruit dryness on the finish. Well balanced!
Bottle from Salling. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are rich earthy hops, flowers, yoghurt, malt and fruits. Rich hoppy finish.

Piana obfita, średnio pęcherzykowa, opadając zostawia szkle niewielki lejsing. Barwa złota, opalizująca. Aromat z butelki cytrusowy, limonkowo cytrynowy, po przelaniu dochodzi wyraźna trawa cytrynowa, pelargonia, skórka grejpfruta, do tego odrobina żywicy i białe owoce. Zapach jest bardzo intensywny i przyjemny. W smaku półwytrawne, sporo cytrusów, iglaków, żywicy. Lekka słodycz biszkoptowa szybko kontrowana średnią goryczką, wyraźnie grejpfrutową, punktową, w posmaku albedo i nafta. Nagazowanie średnie do wysokiego, drobniutkie i lekko szczypiące, w odbiorze piwo jest dość oleiste, kremowe - przyjemnie oblepia usta jak olejek do ciasta. 
To moje pierwsze piwo w stylu Cream Ale i muszę przyznać, że w warstwie aromatyczno smakowej bardzo podobne do intensywnego AIPA, z tą różnicą, że ma zdecydowanie przyjemniejszą fakturę.

Tap at Beer Hunters. Hazy amber color, good white head. Light overriped fruityness in the nose, light citrus. Light to medium-bodied. Mango, pineapple, herbal notes. Dill aka Sorachi Ace. Fruity and easy.
Tap @ Konttori. Pours slightly hazy orange, small head. Dill, fruits, citrus in the aroma. Dill, bitter, fruity flavor.
Tap @ Fermentoren. Pours hazy amber with a medium white head. Aroma has some corn, pear, citrus, some dank notes, hops. Citrus, dank hops, orange peel, pear. Pretty darn good.
.15l on tap @ Olutexpo15. Pours clear amber with low head. Aroma is fruits, malts, hops, grape fruits. Flavor is mostly same. Hoppy!
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 God creamet ale. Gode og fine smagsnuancer. Flot farve. Drukket på Amager Bryghus.

Tap @ Amager Tap Takeover @ Ølhus København, Helsinki. Pours a hazy orange. Aroma is citrus, light dill. Taste is very strongly dill. Sorachi Ace dominates here. Some citrus in the background. Quite light.
Draught at Ølhus København. Copper color, white head. Bittersweet taste with citrus, cream, mango, peach, toffee and grass. Bittersweet finish with citrus, hops, mango and toffee. Excellent brew.
@Olut Expo 2015amber. Grren berries, cktrus, bit twigsy nose, bit huskey caramels. Med bodied, soft sweet caramels. Dryish, flavourful.-- bb
Tap@ olutexpo 2015. Amber, thin white head. Tropical fruity, sweet, citrusy aroma. Flavor has tropical fruits, light sweetness, pineapples, mango. Decent bitterness. Awesome.
Draft. An amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of hops, malt, and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, and citrusy hops, leading to a bitter finish.

Draught @ OlutExpo 2015


Pours orange with a smooth head. Aroma of sweet caramely malts, toffee and syrup. Taste is sweet, caramely and syrupy with some hops and toffee. Finish is sweetish and hoppy. Okay.
Tap at Olutexpo 2015, Helsinki. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Tropical fruits, fruits, hops, sweetness and malts.
Spina ad Eurhop. Color ambra, bassa carbonazione, miele, frutta rossa, mandarino. Corpo medio

At Eurhop 2015 in Rome - Italy, on tap. Pours amber hazy, tick off white head. Nose: cream, a bit lactic, grainy, some tangerine. Mouth: oily body, bitter hoppy , Yasmine, creamy body, bitter overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Large creamy light off white head that mostly lasted. Very pleased aroma of malt and fruit with some light pine and hint of grapefruit. Light sweet and bitter flavor in balance. Quite creamy texture. Light lingering finish.

500 ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of floral notes, dill (thanks Sorachi Ace!) and some honey-like sweetness. Flavour of crisp floral bitterness, heavy dill notes, honey, a bit of harsh grainy notes and some rice. Light bodied. Quite high carbonation. Dill hop hatred.

50 cl bottle.
Pours clear golden color with a medium white head. Herbal aroma, dill, Sorachi Ace..., some fruits. Mandarin, dill and hay on the flavor, some yeast, very weird flavor. Disappointing. 
3323

Bottle share at Chrisos. Hazy orange, still, small foamy white head. Aroma is plasticky, lemon, vanilla and passionfruit. Body is medium, soft carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is dry, pithy citrus, lemon, astringent finish. Pretty nice.
Opaque amber, medium white head. Hoppy, citrusy aroma with hints of toffee as at warms up a bit. Bitter and fruity with hints of vanilla. Nice brew.

duft: krafitg duft af citrus grøn duft lidt krydderier.
smag meget smæk på smagen både i for af bitterhed og humle citrus lime appelsin, lidt grøn smag parfumeret,

yellow/orange hazy beer, 2 fingers of white head.
aroma: hoppy, grass, citrus. Not too much of tropical fruits.
taste:medium to high grassy lingering bitterness.
Palate: medium body, kinda creamy, long lingering bitterness on finish.
Overall: average stuff. Harsh bitterness.

500ml bottle from Uba ja Humal, Tallinn. Batch nr:. 1101 Bedst før 07/201X.


Hazy orange colour with a white head. Hopjuice, fruity, herbal, citrus, refreshing, mild. OK.

Draught at Amager Bryghus. Clear amber - Offwhite head. 
Nice hoppy. Soft malty base. Sweetness. Resin notes. A bit heavy on Sorachi Ace. Grassy. Nice bitterness. Toasted. Fat fresh hoppy.

Bottle at Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2015, Ulfborg. Pours Clear golden with a small off white head. Aroma of fruits, light citrus and cream. Flavour is light moderate sweet and bitter. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Copper amber pour with white head. Aroma and taste is prominent hoppy forward, citrus fruity notes, some sweet malts, buttery, spicy medium bitter hoppy finish. very good
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 280815
Bottle. Clear golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop, spicy and a grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, grapefruit, pine, medium sweet and medium bitter.
Bottle. Moderate malty and Little hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finnish. Oily palate.

Sampled at 8th Danish Ratebeer Gathering, Ulfborg 2015. Bottle. Hazy yellow color, average sized white head. Smell and taste some malts, hops, light to moderately fruity, some bitter. Medium body and carbonation.

Der milde Hopfen wird von der Bitterkeit übertrumpft, was aber noch zu einem frühen Zeitpunkt wechselt. Steigend bitter, der Hopfen bleibt angenehm und im Hintergrund, ist aber immer gut erkennbar. 9/9/9/9/9/9
Leicht trübes dunkel goldgelbes Bier mit einer geringen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch scharf hopfig, grasig bitter. Geschmack sehr hopfig, scharf malzig, getreidig, sehr bitter im Abgang!

Draught @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours golden with a white head, lacings. Aroma of malt, dry grassy hops, herbs, pepermynth, dill. Flavor is light bitter, malt, grassy herbs, dill, some pepermynth. Medium body, soft carbonation, dry and rather bitter finish. Works pretty good for a beer with Sorachi Ace, nice. 270815

Draught @ Køge beer festival. Appearance: pours slightly cloudy yellow with hood off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: tropical fruits, citrus, bread and some biscuit hints. palette medium hoppy aroma, average carbonation, medium body, light to average sweetness, slightly dominated by an average bitterness, medium duration and an oily to creamy texture. Overall: nice hoppy cream ale

Bottle. Sensoric. Amber with medium, beige white head. Medicore head retention and lacing. Nose is medium tropical fruits aroma (mango, lychee) with some light floral accents. Light and biscuity malty profile. Taste is light to medium bitter, quite short with some earthy notes. Medium body, creamy/velvet texture, medium carbonation, finish is semi-dry and shortly bitter.
Bottle at Chris and Ruths pre-GBBF 2015. Hazy golden beer with an offwhite head. Hoppy fruity citrus aroma. Hoppy citrus grassy fruity flavour.

WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, opalizujące. Piana wysoka, drobna i dość trwała.
AROMAT: Średnio intensywny, chmielowy. Soczyste cytrusy (grejpfrut, limonka), owoce tropikalne (marakuja). W tle czuć jakby kremowo-karmelową nutę.
SMAK: Sporo grejpfruta, poza tym łagodny posmak płatków ryżowych. Goryczka wysoka, krótka.
OGÓLNIE: Przyznam szczerze, że jak na pierwszego Cream Ale, to bardzo dobrze trafiłem! Inaczej wyobrażałem sobie ten styl, ale być może jak zawsze nowofalowe odmiany chmielu dodały powiew świeżości do "nudnego" zwykle stylu...
Tap.Hazy orange colour with small head.Aroma of orange peel and sorachi hops,dry hoppy and creamy with hint of herbs and toffee caramel,nice and well balanced mouthfeels and smooth creamy finish.
@ Basunen 15-8-22: en frisk och krispig doft. Smaken är tydlig humlig med toner av zest och vitpeppar. Trevlig.
por golden with a fine white head. fruity and caramel aroma, nearly butter scotch. taste medium bitter. medium bodied, average carbonation. light bitter finish.

15--AUG-2015, bottle @home, from the Brewery.
Hazy golden with lasting, lacing, off-white head.
Very bitter, also a berry bitterness?
Malty, hoppy, spicy/fruity - perhaps Sorachi?
I did not like this on release day but today this is a mighty fine beer. Perhaps it is just better out of a proper glass?

Warm golden colour, slightest haze, white head. Hoppy aroma, fruity hops, pineapple, apricot, malts. Malty flavour, light sweet, fruity, pineapple. Light bitter finish, fruity hops. Damn, this is a mighty fine beer. Dry-hopped the hell out of it, I presume, very fruity. Not sure Id call it Cream Ale, to be honest, but.. damn!(from 50cL bottle @ a field, on holidays, Voerstreek)
From tap at Fermentoren. Cloudy dark amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, fruit, bitterness, caramel, malt and citrus.
On tap at brewdog, Göteborg. Hazy golden amber with white head. Both smell and taste have too much sorachi ace for my taste. Dry.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2016 Draught @ Fermentoren, Halmtorvet 29 c, Copenhagen, Denmark 1700. [ As Amager / 2cabeças  Marry Me In Rio ].Unclear medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, sweet malt, sugary malt, moderate hoppy, orange - citrus. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, sweet malt, fruity malt, dry, fruity hops. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150721]
 7-3-7-3-13 
Bottle 500ml. @ [ (Chris and Ruths pre-GBBF tasting 2015) by chriso - London ]. [ As Amager / 2cabeças Marry Me In Rio ].Unclear matt medium yellow color with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, sweet malt, moderate hoppy, citrus, hops, orange - citrus. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, sweet malt, pineapple, fruity malt, fruity hops, pine notes. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150808]
 7-2-7-3-14

Bottle at Pre-GBBF shindig 2015. It pours hazy gold with a thick white head. The nose is soft, juicy, fruity brioche, candied peel, peach, pineapple and soft dough. The taste is crisp, bitter, juicy pine, peach, apricot, grassy, orange rind, grapefruit, guanabana and earth with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Fruity and crazy drinkable. Very tasty.

Bottle. Pours dark golden with small white head. Aroma is fruity,wet and rotten hay, some sourness, yeast, malty, citrus. Taste is sourish, slightly grassy, milky, citrus. Medium body. Bitter finish. Ok beer.

Aromat to słodkie tropiki z amerykańskiego chmielu, chleb kukurydziany i odrobina słodu. W tle pałęta się lekki DMS, ale tutaj dziwnie pasujący, coś jak masełko w czeskim lagerze.
W smaku rześkie, owocowe, z solidną, lekko oblepiającą słodową podbudową. Intrygujące i smaczne.
Tap @ C4, Odense. Pours unclear golden with a white head. Grapefruit, pine, bread, Sweet toffee like notes. Power bitter finish. Well okay but not anything I would really wanna drink.

Bottle from Kihoskh. Hoppy smell with mostly dill and some crawfish brine, some citrus and passionfruit in the background. Similar taste. Another ratebeerian told me he thought of coconut and mango. I can understand the connection but for me this is more crawfish. However its not as bad as the single hop Sorachi beers Ive had. It doesnt have that sharp burned plastic. Its actually drinkable but would definitely be better without Sorachi.

Clear yellow, large white head.
very aromatic and quite strong hoppy aroma, flowery, depth, super nice aroma in fact. Flavor is bitter hoppy, some malty balance, lots of flavor for a 5.5% beer, dry and bitter, this could be called a session dipa lol..

8th August 2015Pre GBBF tasting at Chris and Ruths. Hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Light pale malts, little creamy sweetness. Tangy fruits. Mildly spicy pine. Touches of citric peel and tropical fruits. Something savoury before a light and mildly bitter finish. Nice.

bottle. 
Nose is grapefruit, funk, lots of citrus. Pretty orange-gold with lace. Fruity flavor, citrus, crackers. Interesting.
Bottle at pre GBBF 2015. Hazy pale gold. Lasting white head. some spice some spice some soap. OK. Spicy though.

Clear golden copper beer, medium white head. Nose is creamy malt, peaches, Sorachi strawberry and coconut. Flavor is malts, grass, grapefruit, Sorachi. Medium bitterness in the finish with lemons and grapefruit.
Bottle. Pours golden with whiteish head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is sweet, malt, fruits, citrus. Flavor is sweet and bitter, citrus, malt, lemon. Finish is grapefruit bitter. Overall: nice one.

Bottle at Chris and Ruths Shindig 2015. Hazy golden beer with a small head. Hoppy fruity aroma, citrus, pine apples,floral, some hay. Hoppy citrus flavor, grassy, hay, peach, passion fruit, floral notes. Kinda fresh.
On tap @ Brew Dog, Gbg. Hazy amber with a small off white head. Fruity and hoppy tones. Fruit, malt, spices and hops. Medium body with a nice balanced finish.
From tap. Pours hazy orAnge with a small white head. Grapefruity hoppy. Solid bitter and fruity. Crisp hoppy finish.

Sour berries and citrus on the nose. The flavor is butter, citrus and fruity. Wonderful bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Slightly bitter but fortfarnade good to drink. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Aroma and taste is prominent sorachi hoppy forward, citrus fruity notes, some sweet malts, buttery, spicy medium bitter hoppy finish.
50 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy amber with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are red berries, citrus, caramel, and pine - with a bitter finish.

500ml bottle - thanks Kairi!
Ugh! Disgusting sorachi ace aroma, fuck, thats just bad, everything I dislike about the hop. Pale peach, small tight head. Better in the mouth, just a clear sorachi influence, a bit coconut buttery, but rather drinkable. Nice full palate. Nice bitter finish, peppery, good dry bitterness. Really improves after the aroma. Actually quite like it after a while.

Bottle, bought @YNWA Beershop, Kolding. Pours clear golden with a medium, staying, creamy white head. Aroma has sweet doughy malts, grapefruit, citrus, oranges, peach. Medium carbonation, fine dry and fairly light mouthfeel. Flavour has sweet malts, light sugary, heavy bitterness, grapefruit, citrus, slight herbal. Lingering dryness. A very nice, drinkable cream ale.

(50 cl bottle from the brewery; Batch #1101; BBD: July 2016) Poured into a Maisel & Friends footed tulip glass reveals a cloudy amber with two finger white head that recedes leaving mostly film and plenty of lace. Good regeneration. Aroma is plenty of fresh sorachi ace and crystal malts. Oily texture, medium body, medium carbonation and a lingering, flavourful finish. Flavour is aroma-driven and well-balanced with a pleasant yet subtle malt backbone.

The aroma is full of cascade hops, rice, pine needle, citrus, flowers and fruits. The color is dark caramel and golden. The taste is full of cascade hops, pine needle, citrus, flowers and fruits. The finish is long and little bitter. A nice beer!

Bottle. Light hazy copper with a medium sized white head. Hoppy nose with citrus, honey, sweet tropical fruits. The flavour is also hop driven with notes of dill, honey, citrus, pine, light white bread. Soft mouthfeel with mild sweetness and some bitterness that lasts into a long hoppy and dry finish. Refreshing and easy to drink.
Draft @ the brewery. Pours a hazy amber color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty creamy spicy aroma with hoppy hints. Fruity malty creamy hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty creamy finish.

Draught at Amager Bryghus. High fluffy white lasting head. Hazy yellow body,. Acidic lemon grapefruit pine aroma and flavor with a fair amojnt of hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long b itter finish.

Draught at Amager Bryghus.
Hazy amber colored with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and pine needles
Fruity flavor of hops, pine needles and vanilla.
Dry hoppy finish.

Amber slight haze. Red fruit. Cranberry. Faint red berries. Dry pretty heavy lingering. Light no alcohol feeling but the bitterness increase the mouthfeel.
On tap at Amager Bryghus. Hazy brown golden with a small white head. Herbal, fruity, floral aroma with a touch of malt. Dry, hoppy flavour with too much Sorachi Ace.
Tap at amager. Pours amber hazy, with light white head. Aroma of hops, caramel, butterscotch. Taste is hops, malts, butterscotch, fruity, grain. Bitter and dry finish. Sorachi ace blah
